Class Drawable

java.lang.Object
  Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circle, Line, Rectangle, Text, Triangle
public abstract class Drawable
extends Object

A class to represent something that is drawable on the canvas. Drawable things have a position, color, may or may not be visible on the canvas, may be drawn as a filled or outline shape.

Version:
October 2013
Author:
Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes. Modified by Tony Beaumont.

Method Detail

changeColor

public void changeColor(String newColor)
Change the color. Valid colors are "black", "blue", "cyan", "darkGray", "gray", "green", "lightGray", "magenta", "orange", "pink", "red", "white", "yellow". You can also provide an RGB string of the format "r,g,b" where r, g and b are numbers in the range 0 to 255.

getColor

public String getColor()
Find out the color of the shape.

Returns:
the color that this object is drawn in.

getPosition

public Point getPosition()
Get the position of this shape.

Returns:
a Point object containing the X and Y coordinates of the shape.

getStrokeWidth

public float getStrokeWidth()
Get the stroke width.

Returns:
the width of the stroke use to draw this object.

getX

public int getX()
Get the x coordinate of the shape

Returns:
the x coordinate of the shape

getY

public int getY()
Get the y coordinate of the shape

Returns:
the y coordinate of the shape

isFilled

public boolean isFilled()
Find out if the object is drawn filled.

Returns:
true when the object is filled and false if outline only.

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Find out if the object is visible or not

Returns:
true when the object is visible on the canvas and false otherwise.

makeInvisible

public void makeInvisible()
Make this object invisible. If it was already invisible, do nothing.

makeVisible

public void makeVisible()
Make this object visible. If it was already visible, do nothing.

moveDown

public void moveDown()
Move the object a few pixels down.

Move the object horizontally by 'distance' pixels.

Parameters:
distance - the distance to move the object.

Position the shape in a new, random position.

Specify the object should be drawn as a solid filled shape.

public void setOutline()
Specify the object should be drawn as an outline only.

                        int y)
Set a new position for the shape.

Parameters:

y - the new y coordinate

setStrokeWidth

public void setStrokeWidth(double width)
Set the stroke width. The default stroke width is 1.0.

Parameters:
width - the width of the stroke use to draw this object.
